alert.note: Alert for Allegheny (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 23 at 11:07AM EST until February 28 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Ohio River At Pittsburgh affecting Allegheny County. .Previous and forecast rainfall will lead to a rise above 18 feet at the Ohio River at Pittsburgh, with a double crest expected. The river will remain elevated through the weekend.
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz. PAC003-240800- /O.EXT.KPBZ.FL.Y.0006.000000T0000Z-220228T1200Z/ /PTTP1.N.ER.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.NO/ 1107 AM EST Wed Feb 23 2022 ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Ohio River at Pittsburgh. * WHEN...Until Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Water begins to flow onto the Monongahela Parking Wharf. At 19.0 feet, Water begins to flow onto the North Shore riverwalk between the stadiums. At 19.5 feet, The Monongahela Parking Wharf is completely flooded. At 20.0 feet, Water is up to one foot deep in the lower areas of the North Shore Riverwalk. At 22.0 feet, The Tenth Street Bypass floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 17.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 19.7 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall to 18.1 feet and begin rising again Friday morning. It will rise to 20.5 feet Saturday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Action stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
